sect2.title: Installation of Sysvinit
sect2.para: When run-levels are changed (for example, when halting the system), init sends termination signals to those processes that init itself started and that should not be running in the new run-level. While doing this, init outputs messages like Sending processes the TERM signal which seem to imply that it is sending these signals to all currently running processes. To avoid this misinterpretation, modify the source so that these messages read like Sending processes started by init the TERM signal instead:

screen.userinput: sed -i 's@Sending processes@& started by init@g' \ src/init.c

sect2.para: Now we do some modifications so we can boot into this during our build:

screen.userinput: cp src/Makefile src/Makefile.orig sed -e 's@root@0@g' \ -e "s@/dev/initctl@${LFS}&@g" \ -e 's@\(mknod \)-m \([0-9]* \)\(.* \)p@\1\3p; chmod \2\3@g' \ src/Makefile.orig > src/Makefile
make -C src clobber make -C src CC="${LFS_TARGET}-gcc" LDFLAGS="-s"
install -d ${LFS}/bin install -d ${LFS}/usr/bin install -d ${LFS}/usr/include install -d ${LFS}/usr/share/man/man{1,5,8} install -d ${LFS}/etc make -C src install INSTALL="install"

sect2.title: Configuring Sysvinit
sect2.para: Create a new file ${LFS}/etc/inittab by running the following:

screen.userinput:
cat > ${LFS}/etc/inittab << "EOF" # Begin /etc/inittab
id:3:initdefault:
si::sysinit:/etc/rc.d/init.d/rc sysinit
l0:0:wait:/etc/rc.d/init.d/rc 0 l1:S1:wait:/etc/rc.d/init.d/rc 1 l2:2:wait:/etc/rc.d/init.d/rc 2 l3:3:wait:/etc/rc.d/init.d/rc 3 l4:4:wait:/etc/rc.d/init.d/rc 4 l5:5:wait:/etc/rc.d/init.d/rc 5 l6:6:wait:/etc/rc.d/init.d/rc 6
ca:12345:ctrlaltdel:/sbin/shutdown -t1 -a -r now
su:S016:once:/sbin/sulogin
c0:12345:respawn:/sbin/agetty 115200 ttyS0 vt100
# End /etc/inittab EOF
